meanings.definition: The state of being in bondage or servitude.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, thralldom meant being a servant to a powerful lord.
meanings.sent2: She felt trapped in thralldom, unable to break free from her oppressive situation.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to be in thralldom to the dog, but secretly ruled the house when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The thralldom of addiction held him tightly in its grip, making it hard to escape.
meanings.sent5: The thralldom of poverty weighed heavily on the villagers, limiting their opportunities for a better life.

meanings.definition: The condition of being under the control or power of another.
meanings.sent1: The king's thralldom over his subjects was absolute, with no room for dissent.
meanings.sent2: She resented the thralldom of her boss, who micromanaged every aspect of her work.
meanings.sent3: The thralldom of the remote control was a constant battle in their household, each family member vying for control.
meanings.sent4: The thralldom of fear paralyzed him, preventing him from taking any risks in life.
meanings.sent5: The thralldom of technology kept the children glued to their screens, oblivious to the world around them.
